parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To be courageous, confident, of good cheer. Another form for tharseo; to exercise courage.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To be well-pleased, think it good, be resolved. From eu and dokeo; to think well of, i.e. Approve; specially, to approbate.
To go abroad, be absent. From a compound of ek and demos; to emigrate, i.e. vacate or quit.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
To be at home, live in a place. From a compound of en and demos; to be in one's own country, i.e. Home.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
